abstract: In his 23 years working in the newspaper’s newsroom — as opposed to delivering its copies — Mr. McGrory has been a reporter, columnist and metro editor. He succeeds Martin Baron.
snippet: In his 23 years working in the newspaper’s newsroom — as opposed to delivering its copies — Mr. McGrory has been a reporter, columnist and metro editor. He succeeds Martin Baron.
lead_paragraph: 8:44 p.m. | Updated The Boston Globe announced on Thursday that Brian McGrory, a columnist and former metro editor at the newspaper and a Boston native with deep roots in the area, would be its next editor. The appointment is effective immediately.

headline.main: Brian McGrory Rises From Boston Globe Paperboy to Become the Paper’s Next Editor
headline.print_headline: Columnist at Boston Globe to Become Its Next Editor
